property.name: Udi
property.tp:docstring: Operating-system specific transient device hardware identifier. This is an opaque string representing the underlying hardware for the device, and shouldn't be used to keep track of individual devices. For some device types (Bluetooth, Modems) it is an identifier used by the hardware service (ie bluez or ModemManager) to refer to that device, and client programs use it get additional information from those services which NM does not provide. The Udi is not guaranteed to be consistent across reboots or hotplugs of the hardware. If you're looking for a way to uniquely track each device in your application, use the object path. If you're looking for a way to track a specific piece of hardware across reboot or hotplug, use a MAC address or USB serial number.

property.name: Interface
property.tp:docstring: The name of the device's control (and often data) interface.

property.name: IpInterface
property.tp:docstring: The name of the device's data interface when available. This property may not refer to the actual data interface until the device has successfully established a data connection, indicated by the device's State becoming ACTIVATED.

property.name: Capabilities
property.tp:docstring: Flags describing the capabilities of the device.

property.name: Ip4Address
property.tp:docstring: The IPv4 address bound to the device. FIXME: what about devices with >1 IP address?

property.name: State
property.tp:docstring: The current state of the device.

property.name: ActiveConnection
property.tp:docstring: Object path of an ActiveConnection object that "owns" this device during activation. The ActiveConnection object tracks the life-cycle of a connection to a specific network and implements the org.freedesktop.NetworkManager.Connection.Active D-Bus interface.

property.name: Ip4Config
property.tp:docstring: Object path of the Ip4Config object describing the configuration of the device. Only valid when the device is in the NM_DEVICE_STATE_ACTIVATED state.

property.name: Dhcp4Config
property.tp:docstring: Object path of the Dhcp4Config object describing the DHCP options returned by the DHCP server. Only valid when the device is in the NM_DEVICE_STATE_ACTIVATED state.

property.name: Ip6Config
property.tp:docstring: Object path of the Ip6Config object describing the configuration of the device. Only valid when the device is in the NM_DEVICE_STATE_ACTIVATED state.

property.name: Dhcp6Config
property.tp:docstring: Object path of the Dhcp6Config object describing the DHCP options returned by the DHCP server. Only valid when the device is in the NM_DEVICE_STATE_ACTIVATED state.

property.name: Managed
property.tp:docstring: Whether or not this device is managed by NetworkManager.

property.name: FirmwareMissing
property.tp:docstring: If TRUE, indicates the device is likely missing firmware necessary for its operation.

property.name: DeviceType
property.tp:docstring: The general type of the network device; ie Ethernet, WiFi, etc.

method.name: Disconnect
method.tp:docstring: Disconnects a device and prevents the device from automatically activating further connections without user intervention.

arg.name: new_state
arg.tp:docstring: The new state of the device.

arg.name: old_state
arg.tp:docstring: The previous state of the device.

arg.name: reason
arg.tp:docstring: A reason for the state transition.
